{"blocks":[{"key":"1jkvd","text":"Run the PCR program: 30 s denaturation at 98\u00b0C; 12 cycles of denaturation at 98 \u00b0C for 10 s, combined annealing and extension at 72\u00b0C for 30 s (shuttle PCR); the final extension at 72\u00b0C for 5 min.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"3702EF1742CC49BCA4D08E039E743F3F","id":680100,"previous_id":680108,"previous_guid":"115FF2923A904C36A5B9AC5215590783","section":"2nd PCR"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"47bnu","text":"Pool all the samples together.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"d5riu","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":1,"key":0}],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[{"type":"notes","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":"

The sample concentrations can be normalized at this step, depending on the experimental questions. Purify the samples separately using AMPure, quantify and pool in the equimolar proportions. Alternatively you can use bead-based normalization, e.g: doi: 10.1186\/1471-2164-15-645<\/a>.<\/p>"}],"guid":"AAF52774EECE4E07906C9D208131B5E4","id":680102,"previous_id":680101,"previous_guid":"D3DCAFD8719C4497B35FEDBB5C4B221D","section":"Pooling"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"73fue","text":"Check the concentration using Qubit and the profile using Tapestation\/Fragment Analyzer. Calculate molarity from that and proceed to the sequencing. {"blocks":[{"key":"28j78","text":"Run the PCR program: initial denaturation at 98\u00b0C for 5 min; 20 cycles of denaturation at 98\u00b0C for 40 s, annealing at 49\u00b0C for 40 s and elongation at 72\u00b0C for 40 s; followed by a final extension step at 72\u00b0C for 5 min.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"9DC38A9350B04E70B22C346C20EFAD34","id":680105,"previous_id":680106,"previous_guid":"F102D9049A684A0EA168B0FEB6959C62","section":"1st PCR"}
